SENT.plain: Thrombotic microangiopathy (TMA) is a microvascular disorder characterized by platelet aggregation and hemolytic anemia
In the setting of bone marrow transplantation (BMT), ischemic colitis due to TMA is difficult to differentiate from acute graft-versus-host disease
We report a 32-year-old man who presented ischemic colitis due to TMA after unrelated BMT for myelodysplastic syndrome
He suffered from treatment-resistant bloody diarrhea, and died of renal failure and Aspergillus pleuritis on day 253 post-BMT
Autopsy revealed endothelial injuries of arterioles and ischemic changes in the intestines and kidneys
Clinical and pathological characteristics of ischemic colitis due to BMT-associated TMA are described
